info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 31 at 3:42PM CDT until March 31 at 4:15PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 PM CDT FOR NORTHWESTERN PUTNAM AND BUREAU COUNTIES... At 341 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Tiskilwa, or 9 miles south of Princeton, moving northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...Golf ball size hail and 70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. This severe storm will be near... Princeton, Bureau Junction and Bureau County Fairgrounds around 350 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this severe thunderstorm include Hennepin, DePue, Malden, Seatonville, Dover, Hollowayville, Coal Hollow, Ottville, Spring Valley Airport, Spring Valley, Ladd, Dalzell, Cherry, Zearing, La Moille and Arlington. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for north central Illinois.
